com.ftdichip.ftd2xx
Class Port

java.lang.Object
  com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.Port

public class Port
extends java.lang.Object

Provides access to a device`s serial port.

Author:
Mike Werner

Method Summary

          Resets this port on the according device.

          Sets the baud rate of the device owning this Port.

Method Detail

reset

public void reset()
           throws FTD2xxException
Resets this port on the according device.

Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the port can not be reset.

setBaudRate

public void setBaudRate(long baudRate)
                 throws FTD2xxException
Sets the baud rate of the device owning this Port.

Parameters:
baudRate - the new baud rate. The range of the value is 32 bit.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the baud rate can not be set.

setDivisor

public void setDivisor(int divisor)
                throws FTD2xxException
Sets the divisor used for non-standard baud rates.

Note: The application note "Setting Baude rates for the FT8U232AM", which is available on www.ftdichip.com , describes how to calculate the divisor for a non standard baude rate.

Parameters:
divisor - the new divisor. The range of the value is 16 bit.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the divisor can not be set.

setDataCharacteristics

public void setDataCharacteristics(DataBits dataBits,
                                   StopBits stopBits,
                                   Parity parity)
                            throws FTD2xxException
Sets the data characteristics for this port.

Parameters:
dataBits - the number of data bits used.
stopBits - the number of stop bits used.
parity - the parity scheme used.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the data characteristics can not be set.

setFlowControl

public void setFlowControl(FlowControl flowControl)
                    throws FTD2xxException
Sets the flow control mode for this port.

Note: This method only supports modes different from XON XOFF, because for this mode additional parameters are needed. In order to set XON XOFF mode use setFlowControl(FlowControl, char, char) instead.

Parameters:
flowControl - the new flow control mode.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the flow control mode can not be set.

setFlowControl

public void setFlowControl(FlowControl flowControl,
                           char xon,
                           char xoff)
                    throws FTD2xxException
Sets the flow control mode for this port.

Note: This method only supports the XON XOFF mode, because for this mode additional parameters are needed. In order to set different modes use setFlowControl(FlowControl) instead.

Parameters:
flowControl - the new flow control mode.
xon - the character to signal XON.
xoff - the character to signal XOFF.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the flow control mode can not be set.

setDTR

public void setDTR(boolean value)
            throws FTD2xxException
Sets or clears the Data Terminal Ready signal.

Parameters:
value - if truesets the signal, otherwise the it will be cleared.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the signal can not be set/cleared.

setRTS

public void setRTS(boolean value)
            throws FTD2xxException
Sets or clears the Request To Send signal.

Parameters:
value - if truesets the signal, otherwise the it will be cleared.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the signal can not be set/cleared.

setBreakOn

public void setBreakOn(boolean value)
                throws FTD2xxException
Sets the BREAK condition for this device to on/off.

Parameters:
value - if truethe BREAK condition is set to ON, otherwise to OFF.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the BREAK condition can not be set.
